docs.title: Reverse
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

docs.title: Section 1 : Getting Started
docs.text: So I told you that often using just JavaScript isn't a great option and that instead using libraries like React is better, because React offers a simpler mental model and provides an easier way of building complex web applications and web user interfaces.

docs.title: 43 import components, file, png
docs.text:
import App from "./App.jsx";
import "./index.css";
import reactIMG from "./assets/react-core-concepts.png";

const entryPoint = document.getElementById("root");
ReactDOM.createRoot(entryPoint).render(<App />);

docs.title: Making Comonents Reusable with Props[]
docs.text:
Prop like a parameter of object , defined by calling function .

And that's why React offers another crucial concept, that's related to components called props.

docs.title: It's All About Components!
docs.text: So React apps are in the end built by combining Components.

docs.title: Why Components?
docs.text:
• Reusable Building Blocks
  • Related Code Lives Together
  • Separation of Concerns

docs.title: What's JSX?
docs.text: And this extension allows developers to describe and create HTML elements by writing HTML markup code inside of JavaScript files.

docs.title: Components functions must follow two important rules.
docs.text:
• Name must start with an uppercase character
  • Returns "Renderable" Content

the function must return a renderable value, typically the to-be-rendered HTML markup.
